comment.text:
We originally planned to eat at a restaurant across the street from Ameer's but it was closed so we came here instead! I'm very glad we came here because it was delicious! I didn't really know anything about it except for the good Yelp reviews (I deeply trust my fellow Yelpers). The restaurant itself is a bit plain. There's not much in it or decoration for that matter. You order at the front register and someone brings the food to your table. During lunch they also have a lunch buffet until 2pm but we missed the cut. 

I had the falafel sandwich which came with homemade French fries. I had no idea it came with fries until it arrived in front of me and it was a pleasant surprise indeed. The only thing I didn't like was if you want any sauce on the side or extra sauce, they will charge you $1.50. The falafel sandwich needed more sauce as it originally comes with tahini sauce and hummus but not enough of it. The falafel balls themselves were amazing! They weren't too hard or too soft. The homemade fries were really good and seasoned well. 

This restaurant is good for groups of all sizes and has lots of healthy options as well!
Enjoyed the food, came with two meats, tabuli salad, hummus, rice. Good lunch options lots of food for the price, two people can absolutely share one lunch plate.

1st time here. Great service, food presentation and mouth watering taste. Unlike other middle eastern restaurants nearby this one has the best spices in the food. The rice isn't bland like other places. I would expect a tabouleh salad but this one worked out nice. Fresh tasting. Crunchy and just the right amount of lemon juice and spices. I even got hooked up with free and extra dessert. I'm part Lebanese and haven't ever tried this middle eastern pudding. Signing off as I'm now entering a food coma. I'll definitely be back with my friends ! Thank you Ameers!
Reasonable prices. (Got 2 meals out of 1 as portions are big )

photos.caption: Chicken shawarma plate & yummy potent garlic sauce with thick mango juice and warm lightly toasted pita bread

owner_replies.comment: Hello my friend Milla.. thank you for the nice review.. very sweet of you... see you back soon

comment.text: New customer, ordered through a delivery service on Friday night, 12/4/20, and it was amazing! We got the chicken kabobs, the shrimp kabobs and the shawarma. I love hummus so I got a side of that too bc I wasn't sure what came with my order but it wasn't needed bc each "plate" came with rice, hummus and a pita, and a Greek salad. I rarely rave about food and I hardly ever write reviews but I had to share and give them props. It was all delicious. We will definitely order from here again and if you're thinking about it, definitely do!

owner_replies.comment:
From the kabobs to the hummus, you'll always deserve the very best of the best! It means the world to know that your order inspired you to share your awesome enthusiasm with everybody, Caitlin. Here's hoping that we can share our cooking with you again sometime soon! 

Sincerely,
Sami S., - Owner

comment.text: My go to place for a quick bite. Sandwiches are good, as well as the lentil soup, which can be hard to find one which taste authentic in atlanta.

I ate my meal so quickly that I didn't even think about how good it tasted. That's my MO for being the youngest in my family and having to fight for scraps.

Okay maybe I'm kidding. A little... 


Ameer's is actually pretty good. I found their Lamb and Beef Shawarma to be really filling. I also love trying falafel wherever I can, and these were very well done. 

I'm glad to have tried Ameer's. Its not in the most convenient place for me, but it's definitely worth a shot. I hope to try it again soon.

Fairly standard halal offerings located off Briarcliff, across from Thai Chili and Sushi Itto. There isn't much by way of decor, save for two lovely wall murals. The menu is extensive but I typically opt for falafel at any Mediterranean / Middle Eastern joint so I can try a bite of everything. The Falafel Plate ($13) comes with a really nice variety: hummus, baba ganoush, falafel, Turkish salad, hot sauce, cabbage salad, and Lebanese salad. I elected to add a side of beet salad (and it was my favorite thing on the plate!). 

My boyfriend tried both the falafel sandwich ($7) and the chicken schawarma sandwich ($8). All the sandwiches come with a side of fries, and both of these were served on soft fresh pita. He devoured both entire sandwiches before I could try them but that seems like a promising recommendation in and of itself. 

We also had the housemade labani, which was especially good on the French fries, and the foul modamas (essentially the Middle Eastern version of refried beans). I think it's an acquired taste but I really liked the labani. The foul modamas was just OK; I probably wouldn't order it again. 

If you're considering eating here, I recommend that you look at the menu on the restaurant's website as it shows pictures of every item (http://www.ameersmediterranean.com/menu/).

photos.caption: Falafel Plate with a side of beet salad

comment.text:
DO NOT USE ONLINE ORDERING ON YELP. I spoke with the owner & they DO NOT have a contract with EAT24 for ONLINE ORDERING. 

FOR TAKE-OUT CALL THEM DIRECTLY! 

I ordered on a week day at 3 pm (New Year's Eve day). Its's located in a mini strip mall next to Marcos Pizza. Easy to miss! 

There was plenty of staff on hand (Counter service). They were very quick, polite & gracious with my order.  The Dining room has 2 sections. The right side has a small dining area with the Counter service & Kitchen. To the left is a spacious dining area with 2, 4 tops & booth seating. There's a flat screen tv for those dining in. 

I ordered take out; 
Chicken kebab sandwich
Sampler: Hummus, Baba Ganoush, Stuffed Grape leaves, Falafel. 

Everything was delicious. The Falafel was crisp on the outside with a fluffy flavorful interior. The Hummus & Baba Ganoush were excellent. The BG was particularly good. The pita was soft & warm. The chicken kebab was moist & perfectly spiced. Steak Fries were cooked perfectly & had a hint of seasoning on them. 

The Owner was particularly kind & asked if I was a new customer. He expressed his hope that the meal would be to my satisfaction & that I would return. Fabulous customer service! 

I will DEFINITELY returning. 
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND Ameer's for YUMMY Mediterranean cuisine.

As a self proclaimed middle eastern food snob, I am truly impressed by the consistently good food this restaurant puts out. Their dips, meats, salads and sandwiches exceed expectations (Have tried Sabeh at 4 restaurants around town....Ameer's was the Best)
Service always super friendly.
And....although completely unimportant to me, the staff has been fully masked the last 3 times I visited.

owner_replies.comment:
Richard, your opinion is valuable to us, so we're humbled by this! Our goal is to always exceed expectations, and it sounds like we were able to do that for you. We look forward to seeing what you'll order next, so come see us again soon! 

Until next time, 
Sami S., - Owner

comment.text:
Don't hesitate. Had the falafel plate. It was fabulous and enough for three to nibble on or for two meals. Called in the order and it was ready in 10 minutes at 7:30 on a Friday night. The staff was very kind with big smiles all around. 

Will definitely return.

A great place to get Mediterranean food about 15 minutes outside of midtown Atlanta!

As an arabic man, I obviously love arabic food. After coming to Ameer's I felt right at home with the smell of fresh baked bread and the friendliness of the staff. I ordered the vegetarian platter and was not disappointed. The falafel and baba ganoush were really good!! I personally was not a fan of the hummus and "cabbage salad" (whatever that it) but besides that I enjoyed my meal. My friends ordered shawarma platters and those were good as well! My favorite thing about this restaurant was how friendly the staff were. They all spoke arabic and loved helping everyone choose what to order!

If you want good arabic food for a fair price, come to Ameer's!

Fabulous Mediterranean food. Ordered delivery. Falafels are amazing. Chicken shawarma dinner and falafel plate was our pick. Tender flavorful chicken. Excellent Arabic rice. Hummus is also wonderful. 
Large amount of food for the price. If you enjoy Mediterranean food, you need to give this place a go.

Ameer's has some of the best Mediterranean food. We were there today before 2pm for their lunch and we're told that the combo menu to the right were $12. I ordered the Kufta and Chicken Kebob combo which came with Basmati rice, Lebanese salad, hummus and a fountain drink. My girlfriend did a combo except with chicken and lamb instead. If you have any variety, value, and Mediterranean food you can't go wrong with this place. I'd also like to add in addition that service is great and will definitely be back!

photos.caption: So much food for the money!
Combo #3 Kufta and Chicken Kebob with Basmati rice, hummus, falafel, Lebanese salad and a fountain drink.

comment.text:
We came here with a Groupon deal. We placed our order in first before seating. We got:

Falafel

Labani: Homemade Cream of Cheese topped with olive oil and zaatar

Chicken Shawarma: Marinated chicken stacked and roasted to a perfect flavor

Beef & Lamb Shawarma: Thinly sliced tender beef and lamb, marinated and stacked. 

Tea

Everything tasted pretty good, except that the beef and lamb meats were a bit overcooked so they were a bit dry. They gave us 4-5 half pitas which was a good amount. All the portions were fair and we had enough for leftovers.

photos.caption: Falafel, pita bread basket, and labani

comment.text: Really Good Mediterranean food, loved the pita bread fresh, soft, fluffy but light, the service was ok...

photos.caption: Combo chicken & beef shawarma w/rice, hummus & a delightful greek cucumber salad. The pita bread is bomb!

comment.text:
A great place to get a large helping of decent Mediterranean food (kababs, shawarma, falafel) in northeast Atlanta.  Ameer's Mediterranean Grill is located next to Waikikie Hawaiian Barbecue near the corner of Briarcliff Road and LaVista Road.  The street is jammed with traffic during rush hour, so it may be better to go later (after 7) if you want to visit on a weekday.  Parking spaces are limited in front of the restaurant, so I'd recommend carpooling.

Highlights: Very big plates of yummy Mediterranean food.  If you don't want that much food, you can grab a sandwich for less than $10.  The sandwiches are medium to large sized and come with a medium sized portion of steak fries.  I ordered a chicken shawarma platter, which included a helping of shredded chicken on a bed of rice, a spoonful of hummus, and a side of Mediterranean salad (cucumber, tomatoes, onions) on a leaf of lettuce.  There's also pita bread served on the side.  The hummus is creamy and well balanced with respect to garlic and lemon flavor.  The rice had a nice blend of seasoning.  My chicken shawarma platter cost  a little over $12 after tax.  The other meat and seafood platters are similarly priced.  If you want combinations (for example shawarma+ falafel, kabab + falafel), these specials are on display by the ordering counter and priced around around $15.

Critiques: The chicken shawarma wasn't bad, but I thought it could be juicier - maybe better served as larger chunks?   Food here is very good, just not quite 5 star Mediterranean food in my opinion.  Dining atmosphere is so-so - I'd recommend this restaurant more for takeout than dining in.

Overall: I'd recommend Ameer's for takeout if you're hungry and want a large Mediterranean platter of good to very good quality.

We just had an amazing meal at Ameer's! It was so delicious & I am so beyond full & still have half of my food left! The prices are fantastic & the food is even better! I had the chicken shawarma & beef lamb combo! My husband had the chicken kabobs & kufta combo! Both were out of this world. The salad is to die for; completely full of flavor & freshness! We will be back for sure! Sam, the owner, is extremely kind & grateful to have all customers, especially new ones! 100% recommend!

owner_replies.comment:
The chicken shawarma and beef and lamb combo will be just as delicious as leftovers, Stephanie! The freshness of the salad really is the perfect highlight for all the other flavors in each combo. I am truly grateful for your support and this kind recommendation. Looking forward to another amazing meal soon!

Until then,
Sami S., - Owner

comment.text: Wish I had pictures to show, but everything was so good it's all gone. I first encountered garlic sauce when I lived in NY and I'm thrilled to find it at Ameer's! The fresh pita and falafel were amazing! We will return many times over!

owner_replies.comment:
A meal so perfect it's not around long enough for a photo is what it's all about, Ronnie. From the fresh pita to he garlic sauce, I'm thrilled to see that you absolutely loved every bite. Here's to doing it all over again sometime soon!

Sincerely,
Sami S., - Owner

comment.text: Food is always fresh and tasty!!!! The staff are always very welcoming . I love the chicken kabobs and taboulleh falafel is always good as well a must try!!!

owner_replies.comment:
It means the world to know that our kabobs and falafel have always been just as great as the friendly staff serving it. Thanks so much for all the kind words, Mikailia. Earning your recommendation means a lot and we can't wait to see you again!

All the best,
Sami S., - Owner

comment.text: The best Mediterranean food in Atlanta! The food has a little something extra that I notice every time. Staff is friendly.

We have been frequenting Ameer's at least twice weekly for as long as I can remember.  We order food for our entire staff - 7-8 entrees each time, lots of variation, and everyone loves everything on the menu.   We have vegans, non-dairy, gluten-free, paleo, you name it; there's plenty for everyone and it's all delicious and flavorful.   

The Turkish coffee is a bonus!  

Sammy and the entire staff are kind, attentive, and present; something one only really finds in small local establishments like this.   We bring colleagues for business lunches as well.  It's just a feel good, real good authentic Mediterranean joint.  

Also always spotless, including the bathroom, which I always consider a measure of a restaurant's care for their customers.  

Love this place and highly recommend.  Ignore any irrelevant reviews - this place is a gem.

owner_replies.comment:
Andi, your support means so much to us -- thank you! This was wonderful to read, as we always enjoy preparing and serving the food for you and your staff. It's always our pleasure! Inspiring our customer's taste buds is always our goal, and we'll always go above and beyond to make sure you love your experience. We look forward to seeing you back again soon! 

Humbly, 
Sami S., - Owner

comment.text: Food and customer service are amazing. Restaurant settings are simple but very comfortable. I would recommend anyone to enjoy a veriaty of Middle Eastern food in one plate at Ameer restaurant.

Ordered again on Thursday for dinner. Falafel app, baba ganoush, beet salad, falafel plate, chicken shawarma and the lamb shank. 

Yes....a lot of food for 2 people but we ate it for Thursday dinner, Friday dinner and Saturday lunch. So delicious! We usually hate beets but the beet salad was not earthy-tasting at all; one of my favorite salads now! I don't eat lamb but my other half said the lamb shank was amazing. 

And seriously...he did not believe me when I told him the price of the lamb shank! 

Only issue was they didn't put any pita bread for the baba ganoush. But it was okay, we just dipped the falafel in the baba and also used the pita that came with the other dishes.

I can't wait to go to the actual restaurant to eat someday!!

owner_replies.comment:
You can never get tired of falafel -- it's just that good! You'll have enough food to make sure you're not left hungry, even if we have to put a whole pack of pita in your order. It's great when you find a restaurant that has something both you and your other half can enjoy. So, the next time you two are in the mood for Mediterranean, we have no problem making lunch and dinner for you!

Best,
Sami S., - Owner

comment.text:
We decided to make the less than 2 mile drive from our house to pick up take out. They are located in a strip shopping center on briar cliff next to the Marcos pizza. We ordered for two; one falafel sandwich and combo #1. Unfortunately dine in wasn't available due to CoVid. We brought the food home and it was nicely packed so nothing would leak .
As soon as we opened our dishes we could smell the aromas of different spices. My wife had the falafel which was nicely cooked all the way through with great flavor. The pita was on the thicker side but went well with the sandwich. The fries were average but tasted great with the side of tzaziki  sauce we ordered 
I had the lamb and chicken gyro platter that came with hummus and side salad and rice. This was definitely a meal for two in it self. The meats were well prepared. I'm looking forward to my lunch tomorrow . The place was also not too expensive, you get what you pay for .

owner_replies.comment:
Foods that compliment each other are the best, Vinay. You know your meal is filled with flavor when you can smell the spices -- and even better when you can taste it. Even though you're only two miles away, we want to make sure your order gets back to your home perfectly packaged so you can fully enjoy it. Glad we could cover dinner and lunch for you. We hope to see you back soon for you next pickup or delivery order.

Best,
Sami S., - Owner

comment.text: Ordered from here before, however today I did Uber eats, ordered 12 wings and only got 6. The wings weren't even fully cooked, I threw them away. Ordered a sandwich with fries and the fries are inedible, they are literally still uncooked from the inside. Called the restaurant and they were rude and unhelpful. Told me to deal with Uber themselves

I ordered delivery from Ameer's so I cannot vouch for the in-restaurant experience. Our food arrived fast, fresh, & warm. 

The chicken schwarma plate was delicious & satisfying. Not mind-blowing but good.

Overall the food was delicious, portions were large, and left satisfied. However, with so many other mediterranean food in the area - I doubt I'll be back.

A good spot to grab lunch with coworkers. Expect a LONG line if you go during lunch on weekdays. The owner is exceptionally nice as he brings out small plates of falafel for you when you wait in line. 
I ordered the lamb kofta kabob (~$15 for the platter)- it comes with two sides (you can pick rice,veggies, spinach dip etc). In my opinion - the food was OKAY- not worth the hype. I also think it's a bit pricey for work lunch type of a place.

The location is good the food is great the service is wonderful. So why is it not five stars?
Well I had to get there myself and decide. 

Yes the location was easy to find in Druid Hills suburb at north Atlanta. Clean store. Nice guys behind the counter took our orders and delivered to our table. 

Lamb kebabs were grilled to perfection. They came in two skewers on a bed of flavorful rice and one of the best chopped salads found anywhere. Then in the middle of all this goodness is a splat of hummus drizzled in the best olive oil available for commoners anywhere. 

The shawerma sandwiches were huge and well filled. Both chicken or beef were big enough for a second meal so make sure you get a bag of the great pita bread to re-assemble the leftovers. 

All the above could have secured the five stars if the baklawa desert had a little more dough to it. Instead it was kind of nut mix with a couple of filo sheets wrapping.
This could be argued as an intentional style of desert but to top that with a pepsi machine that only dispenses ice and gatorade. This cannot be forgiven even though we are in Atlanta where coke dominates even the air people breath. So five stars it is. 

A place worth a visit and a revisit.

***2nd visit...everything is still amazing. Today I tried the first combo with the chicken, beef, and lamb shawarma and it was sooooo good. The chicken is the best part, so juicy and flavorful. I got extra falafel because it is so amazing! I also ordered the kibbeh appetizer and it was really good as well. I can't wait to come back and try something else!!!***

While looking for a place to eat since I suddenly had several hours to do nothing, I found this gem with good reviews. Middle Eastern food is my favorite, plus they had a free appetizer offer, so I figured it was a winning idea. I went in and got my free appetizer of fatayer and a combo meal with beef and lamb shawarma, chicken kabob, falafel, Lebanese salad, rice, hummus, and pita, which also came with a soft drink. Everything was absolutely delicious!! The shawarma was juicy, the chicken was spiced perfectly, the falafel was probably the best I've ever had, and the rice wasn't too buttery. All for under $13 with tax and the free appetizer. I will most definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Combo #1 chicken, lamb, and beef shawarma with an extra side of falafel.

comment.text: Ordered deliver from here for the office. I had the falafel sandwich with fries. Others had the chicken kebabs and lamb/beef kebabs. I also tried the grape leaves. Everything was pretty tasty!!

Amazing! I have been several times and it never disappoints. Best falafel and hummus I have had. The roasted chicken is seasoned very well and the shawarma is to die for. 
I also love the spicy pepper sauce they have on the side. Again, I love Ameer's and will be back soon.

photos.caption: Beef, lamb, and chicken shawarma Combo plate with falafel. Yummy!

comment.text: Mmmmmm I love Ameer's!! The combo plates are no joke! So much food! The first time I came here I got a combo plate with chicken and beef shwarma and it was over flowing with perfectly season and well cooked meat ,Along with 2 falafels, hummus, rice, cucumber salad and a pita. Wow I'm drooling just writing about it. Best cucumber salad hands down. I've recently switched to a plant based diet which banishes me to the veggie plates now, but the falafel plate is just as much food, if not more!  Service is always fast and friendly, and restaurant is clean. This will def be a regular spot for my Mediterranean fix!

photos.caption: Combo #1...chicken/beef shwarma, rice, hummus, cucumber salad, falafel, and pita! So much food!
Falafel plate, swapped out the baba for extra cucumber salad

comment.text: This probably one of the best falafel I had in Atlanta. The place have good location on Briarcliff Rd cross the street from Briarcliff plaza, great Mediterranean food and authentic atmosphere.

1st time got the kofta kabob & gyro. 2nd time got the kofta kabob & lamb/beef shawarma. Priced 8.55 each. All came with fries, which was seasoned perfectly. Love the kofta sandwich. Gonna try the platter next time.

Order delivery from here and was very disappointed in the quantity of food. I ordered the grilled shrimp (not a lunch portion) for $13.99. When I got it there were only 3 grilled shrimp and a ton of rice. While the food was tasty, I really don't enjoy paying $14 for mostly rice.
Authentic Mediterranean food ! I love the garlic sauce ,it's as close to as it gets to the original garlic sauce served with food in Saudi Arabia . I am going to come back for more

I was visiting Atlanta from Jersey. I am extremely picky so I decided to look on yelp. I figured why not saw nothing under 4 stars in reviews. When I arrived a genteleman maybe early 40s greeting me and ask me to see a menu. I ordered the lamb pita. I asked him if its mixed already with the beef. Cause I don't eat beef only lamb. He said No problem I can make that. It was quick. Came back handed me my order. He ask first time. I explained yes, I actually don't live out here; I found you on Yelp. He said awesome don't forget us. Never. Very clean place I may add. 
Got in the car and took a bite. Best I've ever had. The only thing that got me was the pickle/relish. (hate them) yuck. But you can always order without. Thank you

photos.caption: Hands down the best until I ate a pickle/relish. Just ask without next time. He went out his way to just make Lamb. Thank You

comment.text:
Wow!  How have i lived in Atlanta for 23 years and never eaten here before?!?

Best middle eastern fare in the city.  YUM!!!  We had the chicken schwarma and lamb shank.  Both were beyond excellent and the tomato salad with cucumbers was exceptional.  Can't wait to return.  We're still salivating...

owner_replies.comment:
We don't know either, but we're so glad you found us, Kevin! Our chicken shawarma is definitely a favorite, and exceptional food is what you'll get every time. Can't wait to make your next order!

Best,
Sami S., - Owner

comment.text: This restaurant has delicious Mediterranean and Middle Eastern food. My friend and I decided to try this nearby local restaurant for a lunch break and were happy with our choice! I got the falafel plate and substituted the Lebanese salad for extra hummus! The falafel was some of the best I've had, the pita was warm and delicious, and all of the sides (hummus, Turkish salad, baba, cabbage salad) were really good! I would say they had a great selection of food for vegetarians or veggie lovers, which I appreciated! My friend got a chicken plate and said both the chicken shawarma and chicken kabobs were good! Overall, I would recommend this restaurant!

photos.caption: Falafel plate (substituted Lebanese salad for extra hummus)

comment.text: My husband and I recently discovered Ameer's last month. What a find! We had a similar favorite in Houston and have been trying our best to find a great Mediterranean place since moving to Atlanta. The chicken shawarma is especially exceptional but everything we've tried is so good! Don't forget to add the garlic sauce to any dish! Since finding this wonderful restaurant, we find ourselves ordering take out at least once a week!!

owner_replies.comment:
You can never have too much of our garlic sauce, Laura. It's always a great feeling when you come across delicious food. You don't have to look any further now that you and your husband have found your new go-to Mediterranean spot. We'll see you next week for that exceptional chicken shawarma!

Best,
Sami S., - Owner

comment.text: Ordered delivery and it was prompt and friendly. Shared a few sandwiches: falafel and sabich which were both great (although the bread would be toasted to be less soggy), and two apps: the hummous was good, although nothing special, and the fried eggplant salad which was de-li-cious, I couldn't get enough of it. A strong option.

Good food, warm and welcoming staff! 

Options available in the form of Combos image of which is available on the wall. 

Staff confirmed it's Halal and offered spicy sauce as well incase i wanted to spice things up .... 

Good size portions make your Stomach full and you Merry before you leave !!

Get the chicken sandwich. The sauce is like crack cocaine.

Just go. Why are you still reading this?

They play the best music videos on the TV.

My wife and I ordered food to go after not having eaten here in a few years, and we were pleasantly surprised at how good the food was. It was good before, but it was truly exceptional this time. I ordered the Chicken Msahab, which came with yellow rice and hummus. The chicken was amazing, and the portion size was huge. The yellow rice was also very good. I had the Baklava for dessert, which seemed a bit small, but was very flavorful. My wife ordered the Falafel plate, which she said was also really good. We will start coming here more often, and I would highly recommend Ameer's to anyone looking for great Middle Eastern food in Atlanta.

Okay so I don't even eat Mediterranean food. Well.. I've never had it until a couple weeks ago when a coworker brought me here for lunch. 

Well let's just say I'm all for trying new restaurants now. We walk in and the service was great. He explained to me what everything was which made me a lot more comfortable with making a decision. 

The food was phenomenal and then BOOM, I became addicted to restaurant. I came here again today for lunch and again, the restaurant exceeded my expectations.

I highly suggest the chicken kabobs for anyone new to Mediterranean. Chick fil a prices, but ten times tastier. Well done!!

Food is GREAT, and always fresh!! The service is SUPERB!!! This place is definitely a great go to when you want Mediterranean food! They always explain everything to you so that you know exactly what you're getting! I will definitely be back soon!!

This is a great Mediterranean spot. I recommend it.

I've eaten here several times. My recommendation. Hummus with lamb is my go-to meal. It is sauteed chopped lamb with olive oil and pine nuts, nestled on a bed of hummus. 

The tabouli is great and you can test the freshness in the ingredients.
This is my go to place! Love their salad and hummus! The kabobs are also very good. Big portions so I usually have lunch for the next day

We ordered Uber eats, and it was so good! Maybe the prices are a bit high for what you get (like the appetizer salads are $6), but overall the prices are not as expensive as rumi's kitchen.  The food quality was awesome, very delicious. Recommend the labini and Lebanese salad. Falafel is excellent.

photos.caption: Beef and Lamb Shawarma Dinner but it was missing the lamb :(

owner_replies.comment:
Those are some tasty recommendations! Our authentic foods are made with the finest ingredients, so we're glad you could taste the quality and hope you found it worth the price. Whether it's a Lebanese salad or falafel, we can't wait to make another for you!

Best,
Sami S., - Owner

comment.text:
Ameer's is what happens when you care what food you're making. They nail it.

Here's what I usually get:
-Beef and lamb shawarma plate (comes with rice, tomato+cucumber salad, rice, tahini sauce, and a pita)
-Baba ghanoush 

The plate: A+ . The beef and lamb is perfectly spiced, the rice is cooked but not mushy, and the hummus + warm pita is to die for. 

The baba: A+. It's smoky, it's salted just enough, it's my favorite baba ghanoush in Atlanta thus far. 

I also want to point out the pita: Order extra. It's freshly made, and they're perfectly soft pillows of carby goodness. 

The portions are also huge! This order lasts me through lunch, dinner, and a late night snack. :)
